sentences.english: April and Corinnehad been gone from home for some time, so I had no way of knowing what they looked like.
sentences.chinese: 阿普里爾和科琳已離家多時，我無緣一睹她們的芳容。

sentences.english: People huddled around the theatre in order to have a look at her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 人們聚集在劇場的周圍，以便一睹她的芳容。

sentences.english: Why is beauty able to disclose fragrant Rong in the physics?
sentences.chinese: 美爲什麼會在物理學中泄露芳容呢？

sentences.english: Each time, the world was eager to see how nearly perfect she had become.
sentences.chinese: 每一次，整個世界都渴望一睹她幾近完美的芳容。

sentences.english: But what we've never been able to do is stand completely outside the Milky Way and look back at it.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我們至今還無法從銀河系之外一睹它的芳容。

sentences.english: Star-struck crowds strain their necks for a glimpse of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 追星的人羣升長脖子爲一睹他妻子的芳容。

definition: to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
lit. I've admired you for a long time (honorific)./I've been looking forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
to get close to/to get on intimate terms with
variant of 風采|风采[feng1 cai3]
divine fragrance, national grace (idiom); an outstanding beauty
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
